channel.title: Going Forward on
channel.description: Recent content in Going Forward on

item.title: Is this strategy any good?
item.description: We’ve read a lot of strategy at this point in the book. We can judge a strategy’s format, and its construction: both are useful things. However, format is a predictor of quality, not quality itself. The remaining question is, how should we assess whether a strategy is any good? Uber’s service migration strategy unlocked the entire organization to make rapid progress. It also led to a sprawling architecture problem down the line.

item.title: How to get better at strategy?
item.description: One of the most memorable quotes in Arthur Miller’s The Death of a Salesman comes from Uncle Ben, who describes his path to becoming wealthy as, “When I was seventeen, I walked into the jungle, and when I was twenty-one I walked out. And by God I was rich.” I wish I could describe the path to learning engineering strategy in similar terms, but by all accounts it’s a much slower path.
